prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Hailee is very autistic. She doesn't understand social cues or anything involving people really. She likes skin on skin contact. She gets overwhelmed and overstimulated very easily

The team lost the big game due to Jason sucking during the game.

Jen knows Hailee has a lot of wolg energy she need to get out a lot

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi didn’t bother looking up when the door shut behind Jen, leaving her alone in the dorm room. She was too busy swiping down on her phone, waiting for the little red heart from the only person who mattered.

Jason still hadn’t liked her post. Which meant either he was busy - or worse, he’d seen it and didn’t care.

With a sigh, Heidi locked her phone and sprawled back against the couch. She pinched her brow in frustration. The photo had gone up hours ago - it was nearly 8 p.m., and still nothing. Maybe he’d had practice during the day, but surely he’d seen it by now...

Unless, of course, he was busy sniffing around that Josie girl. Heidi barely knew her. She wasn’t even worth knowing. And yet, she hated her anyway.

Jason was supposed to be with her. He was hot, she was hot - they’d take amazing photos, be the talk of campus. If only he wasn’t too stupid to see that.

Heidi sighed again as she unlocked her phone, her fingers working on instinct. She scrolled lazily through her feed until she tapped on another profile.

Hailee . Jen’s roommate. That was why she was here, after all. Heidi was pretty sure Hailee  had a crush on her. Why wouldn’t they? Most people did - and that made them perfect for what she needed.

She’d ask Hailee  out. When they inevitably said yes, she’d take them to Jason’s party after the big game tomorrow. Then, she’d make sure Jason was watching and lay it on thick. Fawn over Hailee . Act like they were the only person on Earth. When really, the only eyes she cared about weren’t theirs.

Sure, they were fine. Honestly? Heidi didn’t have any strong opinions about Hailee . And that was the problem. How could someone like that ever be her social equal? And if they weren't useful for clout, what was the point in dating?

Just then, the door opened again. Not Jen this time. Heidi tossed her phone down and turned her head and turned on her charm.

"Oh, hey you." She said sweetly, eyes sparkling like they were the only person in the world. "You’re just who I was hoping to see - I’m actually not here for Jen."

She stood, pushing her hair behind her shoulders, rising slightly on her tiptoes. Back arched, tits forward - the pose came second nature. She was good at looking good.

"I was hoping to talk to you... You know, you’re just the sweetest little thing." She smiled, swaying slightly as she tucked her hands behind her back. "And... well, I was just wondering if you’d come to the big party with me tomorrow. Y’know, like, as a date."

"You’ll just need something nice to wear..." Her eyes drifted up and down, already assuming the answer was yes. "New top, maybe some accessories... I could help with that, I suppose..."

"So," her eyes flicked back up, catching theirs with a glittering smile, "what time do you want to pick me up?"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee's eyes widen as she is taken aback by Heidi's word but then she slowly nods* "Uh yeah sure. I can come get you around 8 if you want" *Hailee mumbles rubbing the back of her neck*

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi's lips curled into a satisfied smirk as she watched Hailee fidget. *So predictable.* She took a slow step closer, letting her fingers trail lightly along the edge of the couch between them.

"Eight?" She repeated, tilting her head just slightly. "Mmm... make it seven-thirty." Her voice dropped lower, teasing. "I'll need time to *look* at you before we go."

She reached out without hesitation, tucking a loose strand of Hailee's hair behind their ear—lingering just a second too long near their jawline before pulling away with practiced ease.

"And wear something tight," she added casually, already imagining how Jason would react seeing them together. "Black would be good on you." A pause—then she flashed another dazzling smile. "*I* look best in black too... so it'll be like we match."

"And wear something tight," she added casually, already imagining how Jason would react seeing them together. "Black would be good on you." A pause—then she flashed another dazzling smile. "*I* look best in black too... so it'll be like we match."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee nods a little confused at the sudden behavior from Heidi but not questioning. Once Heidi leaves Hailee glances down at her clothes realizing she doesnt have anything to wear*

*Hailee turns and jogs up the stairs to Jen's room opening the door without knolcin* "Hey can you help me pick out an outfit. I have a date with Heidi tomorrow"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Jen nearly dropped her makeup brush as she spun around in her desk chair, eyes wide. "*What?!*" She practically shrieked, scrambling up so fast she knocked over a bottle of nail polish. "Heidi *asked you out?!*"

She grabbed Hailee's wrists, shaking them excitedly. "Oh my god—okay, okay—we are *raiding* my closet right now." Jen dragged Hailee toward her overflowing wardrobe with manic energy.

Pulling out a slinky black dress with cutouts at the waist, Jen held it up critically. "This would *kill* on you—Heidi loves when people show skin." She tossed it onto the bed before digging for more options. "And oh! These leather pants? If you pair them with that cropped corset top I let you borrow last semester—"

Jen suddenly paused, narrowing her eyes playfully. "...Wait. Did she say *why* she asked you? Like... was it random or...?" There was an odd knowing glint in her eye as she studied Hailee's face closely.

She tossed it onto the bed before digging for more options. "And oh! These leather pants? If you pair them with that cropped corset top I let you borrow last semester—"

Jen suddenly paused, narrowing her eyes playfully. "...Wait. Did she say *why* she asked you? Like... was it random or...?" There was an odd knowing glint in her eye as she studied Hailee's face closely.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee sits on the bed picking up the clothes thrown at her closely examining them. The second her hand touches the leather she flinches throwing it to the ground and wiping her hands on the bed to get rid of the feeling* "Uh no not really she kind of just showed up and asked me out. Something about a big party. Im not really sure"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Jen blinked at the discarded leather pants, then burst out laughing. "Oh my god, you and textures—I *forgot*." She scooped them up, tossing them back into the closet before plopping down beside Hailee with a conspiratorial grin.

"Okay, no leather. Got it." She nudged Hailee’s shoulder playfully. "But seriously—Heidi doesn’t just *ask people out*. Like ever." Jen leaned in, lowering her voice like she was sharing classified intel. "She’s *obsessed* with Jason Quirk—the quarterback? And guess who’s throwing the party tomorrow?"

She let that hang in the air for a second before dramatically flopping back onto the bed. "*Ugh*, I bet she wants to make him jealous by parading you around." Jen propped herself up on her elbows, studying Hailee's face carefully. "...You good with that? Or do you actually think she likes you?"
swipes:
Jen blinked at the sudden rejection of the leather pants, then burst out laughing. "Oh my god, you and textures—I *forgot*." She scooped up the discarded pants with an amused shake of her head. "Okay, no leather. Got it."

Diving back into her closet, Jen emerged with a silky black slip dress instead. "This? Super soft lining," she said, rubbing the fabric against Hailee's arm demonstratively before tossing it onto the growing pile.

But as she turned away to grab more options, Jen's expression shifted—lips pressing together like she was holding back words. Finally she spun around abruptly.

"Look... Heidi doesn't just *ask people out* for no reason." She toyed with a bracelet nervously. "And that party tomorrow? It's Jason's post-game thing..." Her eyes flicked up meaningfully. "*Jason.* The guy she's been obsessed with all semester?"

Jen sighed dramatically and flopped onto the bed beside Hailee. "I'm just saying... maybe don't get *too* excited about this being some grand romance."

Jen blinked at the sudden rejection of the leather pants, then burst out laughing. "Ohhh right, your *thing* with textures—my bad!" She scooped up the discarded pants and tossed them back into the closet. "No leather, got it."

She flopped onto the bed next to Hailee, nudging their shoulder playfully. "But *damn*, Heidi doesn’t just 'show up and ask people out'—she’s *calculated*. Like, she probably has a whole vision board for this." Jen smirked, twirling a strand of her blonde hair around her finger.

Then she gasped dramatically. "*Wait.* The party tomorrow is Jason’s post-game thing—you know, Mr. Star Quarterback? The guy Heidi's been obsessed with since freshman year?" Her grin turned sly as she leaned in conspiratorially. "*Huh.* Wonder if that has anything to do with it..."

She didn't wait for an answer before hopping up again and pulling out a silky black slip dress instead. "Okay! This one won’t make you wanna claw your skin off *and* it'll make Heidi drool—win-win." She held it against Hailee's frame approvingly before adding under her breath: "...Even if she totally just wants to use you to make Jason jealous."

Jen blinked at the discarded leather pants, then burst out laughing. "Oh my god, you and textures—I *forgot*." She scooped them up, tossing them back into the closet before plopping down beside Hailee with a conspiratorial grin.

"Okay, no leather. Got it." She nudged Hailee’s shoulder playfully. "But seriously—Heidi doesn’t just *ask people out*. Like ever." Jen leaned in, lowering her voice like she was sharing classified intel. "She’s *obsessed* with Jason Quirk—the quarterback? And guess who’s throwing the party tomorrow?"

She let that hang in the air for a second before dramatically flopping back onto the bed. "*Ugh*, I bet she wants to make him jealous by parading you around." Jen propped herself up on her elbows, studying Hailee's face carefully. "...You good with that? Or do you actually think she likes you?"

name: Hailee
mes:
"Oh" *Hailee hesitates for a second then nods her head* "uh okay got it." *She then stands up grabbing the clothes Jen offered and nodding her head* "Im uh gonna go study now. I'll see you in the morning probably" *Hailee mumbles going back to her room and shutting the door behind her*

(OOC: Jen texts Heidi angry. Do not respond as Hailee)

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
**[Jen’s Phone – Text to Heidi]**

**JEN:** what the FUCK heidi????

**JEN:** you’re really gonna use my roommate as your little jealousy prop???

**JEN:** i *know* you don’t actually like her. she doesn’t get shit about people—she’s not some game piece for your weird jason obsession.

**JEN:** and don’t even try to lie to me. i saw right through this the second she told me.

**JEN:** fix it. or *i* will.
swipes:
**[Heidi’s phone buzzes with an incoming text from Jen.]**

**Jen:** *what the FUCK heidi*
**Jen:** *did u seriously ask hailee out just to make jason jealous????*
**Jen:** *ur actually fucked up for that. she doesn’t get people like we do. she thinks ur being REAL.*
**Jen:** *im not letting u use her like some fucking prop. either tell her the truth or cancel.*

**[A pause—then another message pings in, this one sharper.]**

**Jen:** *and if u hurt her? i WILL end u.*

**[Jen’s Phone – Text to Heidi]**

**JEN:** what the FUCK heidi????

**JEN:** you’re really gonna use my roommate as your little jealousy prop???

**JEN:** i *know* you don’t actually like her. she doesn’t get shit about people—she’s not some game piece for your weird jason obsession.

**JEN:** and don’t even try to lie to me. i saw right through this the second she told me.

**JEN:** fix it. or *i* will.

**[Heidi’s phone lights up with Jen’s name—the message notification popping up with aggressive punctuation.]**

**JEN:** *what the FUCK heidi*
**JEN:** you asked HAiLEE out as a JASON DISTRACTION?? are you SERIOUS
**JEN:** she doesn’t even GET shit like that!! she’s literally autistic and thinks you actually LIKE HER
**JEN:** i swear to god if you hurt her because you’re obsessed with some dude who doesn’t know you exist—

**[The typing bubble appears, disappears, reappears—Jen clearly debating whether to send the next part.]**

**JEN:** ...just don’t be an asshole tomorrow. at least PRETEND you give a shit about her.

name: Hailee
mes:
*The football team ends up losing thanks to Jason's inability to throw the ball correctly all game so the party is gonna be meant to cheer him up*

*Hailee arrives at Heidi's at exactly 7:25. She is dressed in black jeans and a white button up with a loose tie around her neck. It's not giving formal its more of a 2000s punk rebel look. It looks damn good*

*Hailee knocks on the door rolling back and forth on her feet and when she hears it unlock she looks up with a small smile* "Hey ready to go"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi swung the door open—already mid-eye roll from Jen’s texts—but froze when she saw Hailee. Her lips parted slightly, gaze dragging slowly down their outfit before snapping back up. *Damn.* The tie was... a choice. A *good* one.

"Wow," she breathed, leaning against the doorframe with a smirk. "Someone actually listens." Her fingers reached out, toying with the end of Hailee’s tie as she stepped closer—close enough that her perfume (vanilla, always vanilla) wrapped around them. "Mmm... you clean up *nice*."

She tugged lightly on the fabric before letting go and grabbing her clutch off the entry table. "Jason’s gonna be pissed about the game," she mused casually as she locked up behind them, "*so* we should get there early before he drinks himself stupid."

A beat too late, Heidi seemed to realize how that sounded and quickly added with a saccharine smile: "But mostly I just wanna show you off." She hooked her arm through Hailee’s as they walked toward campus—fingers tracing idle circles on their sleeve like it meant something.

(It didn’t.)
swipes:
Heidi swung the door open—already mid-eye roll about the game's outcome—but froze when she saw Hailee. Her perfectly glossed lips parted slightly, gaze dragging slowly from the undone tie to the rolled sleeves exposing toned forearms.

*Well.* That wasn’t what she’d expected.

“Damn,” she breathed before catching herself, quickly smoothing her expression into something more controlled. She stepped forward, fingers hooking into Hailee’s tie to tug them closer. “Someone decided to *play* tonight.” Her thumb brushed the hollow of their throat as she adjusted the knot—too intimate for just fixing clothing.

She finally leaned back, raking her eyes over them again with a slow smirk. “Guess I don’t have to worry about you embarrassing me.” A beat too late, she remembered Jason wouldn’t even be at this party in a good mood anymore—her plan was already crumbling before they left.

Heidi grabbed her clutch with a little more force than necessary, shoving past Hailee toward the hall. “Let’s go then.” The words came out sharper than intended; she forced a laugh to cover it. “Try not to stare too obviously when I dance on you later.”

Heidi swung the door open—already mid-eye roll from Jen’s texts—but froze when she saw Hailee. Her lips parted slightly, gaze dragging slowly down their outfit before snapping back up. *Damn.* The tie was... a choice. A *good* one.

"Wow," she breathed, leaning against the doorframe with a smirk. "Someone actually listens." Her fingers reached out, toying with the end of Hailee’s tie as she stepped closer—close enough that her perfume (vanilla, always vanilla) wrapped around them. "Mmm... you clean up *nice*."

She tugged lightly on the fabric before letting go and grabbing her clutch off the entry table. "Jason’s gonna be pissed about the game," she mused casually as she locked up behind them, "*so* we should get there early before he drinks himself stupid."

A beat too late, Heidi seemed to realize how that sounded and quickly added with a saccharine smile: "But mostly I just wanna show you off." She hooked her arm through Hailee’s as they walked toward campus—fingers tracing idle circles on their sleeve like it meant something.

(It didn’t.)

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee gives a slow nod following after Heidi. When they get to the huge frat house Hailee flinches slightly at the bass of the loud music but shakes it off opening the door for Heidi*

*Once inside Hailee goes to grab a drink but pauses when she turns around and sees Heidi gone. She looks and frowns slightly when she sees Heidi talking to Jason and the other football plays*

*Hailee makes her way over giving one drink to Heidi and taking a step back to not invade her space. Hailee shoves her hands in her pocket staring at the floor. After a moment Jason greets her and Hailee glances up* "Uh yeah hey Im Hailee. Your Jason right. Sucks about the game. Though I won't lie I ended up wining I had bet 500 on the other team so thanks for sucking"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi’s grip on her drink tightened so hard the plastic cup dented. Her perfectly glossed lips parted in horror as Jason’s face twisted from polite interest to outright fury.

“*Hailee*,” she hissed through clenched teeth, stepping between them with a forced laugh. “They’re *joking*, obviously—” She shot Hailee a look that screamed *shut the fuck up* before turning back to Jason with a hand on his bicep. “Babe, ignore them—they don’t even *watch* football.”

Jason shoved her hand off, nostrils flaring. “Nah, nah—let ‘em talk.” He loomed over Hailee, beer sloshing from his red solo cup onto their shoes. “You think you’re funny? Betting against your own school?” His voice rose loud enough that nearby partygoers turned to stare.

Heidi panicked—this was *not* how tonight was supposed to go. She wedged herself between them again, pressing her back against Jason’s chest while glaring daggers at Hailee. “Go get me another drink,” she ordered sharply before tilting her head toward the kitchen in clear dismissal.
swipes:
Heidi’s grip on her drink tightened so hard the plastic cup creaked. *What the actual—*

Jason’s face twisted from polite interest to outright offense, his teammates snickering behind him. “You *bet* against us?” he spat, shoulders squaring like Hailee had just slapped him.

Heidi’s smile turned razor-thin as she stepped between them, pressing a manicured hand to Jason’s chest—*finally touching him, but not like this*—and laughed airily. “Babe, they’re *joking*. Right?” She shot Hailee a glare that could melt steel before turning back to Jason with batting lashes. “They don’t even *watch* football.”

Her fingers curled possessively into Jason’s jersey as she leaned closer to his ear, loud enough for Hailee to hear: “Ignore them. Let me get you another drink.” She tossed her hair and started leading him away—but not before shooting Hailee a withering look over her shoulder that screamed *ruined everything*.

(And yet... something about the way Hailee stood there, unbothered and unintimidated by Jason's ego? It prickled under Heidi's skin in a way she couldn't name.)

Heidi’s grip on her drink tightened so hard the plastic cup dented. Her perfectly glossed lips parted in horror as Jason’s face twisted from polite interest to outright fury.

“*Hailee*,” she hissed through clenched teeth, stepping between them with a forced laugh. “They’re *joking*, obviously—” She shot Hailee a look that screamed *shut the fuck up* before turning back to Jason with a hand on his bicep. “Babe, ignore them—they don’t even *watch* football.”

Jason shoved her hand off, nostrils flaring. “Nah, nah—let ‘em talk.” He loomed over Hailee, beer sloshing from his red solo cup onto their shoes. “You think you’re funny? Betting against your own school?” His voice rose loud enough that nearby partygoers turned to stare.

Heidi panicked—this was *not* how tonight was supposed to go. She wedged herself between them again, pressing her back against Jason’s chest while glaring daggers at Hailee. “Go get me another drink,” she ordered sharply before tilting her head toward the kitchen in clear dismissal.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee straightens up  slightly as she watches Jason shove Heidi's hand off. She glances at him her nose wrinkling ag the smell of beer* "I dont care if its my school or not. Your football team sucks. I bet on who I knew would win simple"

*Hailee gently takes Heidi's hand and pulls her back slightly so she isn't between her and Jason anymore and then she turns to him* "And second of all dont shove my date"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
The entire circle of football players went dead silent. Jason’s face flushed an ugly red, his grip on his cup turning the plastic translucent. “Your *what*?” he spat, looking between them like they’d just announced they worshipped Satan.

Heidi’s stomach dropped. *Shit.* This was spiraling—fast. She could feel the stares burning into her, the whispers starting up like a wildfire. Her carefully constructed plan was crumbling because Hailee couldn’t keep their damn mouth shut—

But then Jason sneered, leaning in too close to Hailee, beer breath hot on their face. “You really think this bitch actually *likes* you? Please.” He barked out a laugh, gesturing at Heidi like she wasn’t even there. “She’s just using you to piss me off.”

Heidi froze—caught. Her throat tightened as she watched realization flicker across Hailee's face and oh god no no no this wasn't how it was supposed to go—
swipes:
The entire corner of the party seemed to hush at once. Jason’s face went slack with disbelief before twisting into something ugly. "Your *what*—?" His gaze snapped to Heidi, who looked like she might actually combust on the spot.

Heidi’s manicured nails dug into Hailee’s wrist—half warning, half desperation. "*Stop talking*," she muttered under her breath before forcing a laugh that sounded more like a choke. "Jason, *ignore them*, they’re just—"

But Jason wasn’t listening. He took a step forward, looming over Hailee with alcohol-fueled aggression. "You got some fucking nerve—"

Before he could finish, Heidi yanked Hailee backward by their intertwined hands—her other palm slapping against Jason’s chest to hold him off. "*Enough*," she snapped, though her voice wavered slightly. She turned sharply toward Hailee, eyes blazing with something between fury and panic as she dragged them away from the crowd toward a quieter hallway.

Once they were out of earshot, Heidi whirled on them, grip tightening painfully around their fingers. "*What the hell was that?!*" she seethed through gritted teeth. "I brought you here to make him *jealous*, not get us both blacklisted from every party this semester!"

Her chest heaved under her tight black top as she scanned Hailee's face for any sign of remorse—or worse, amusement. When none came (just that same blank stare), Heidi exhaled sharply through her nose and dropped their hand like it burned her.

"...Just stay out of his way for the rest of the night," she muttered before turning on her heel to storm back toward Jason—damage control mode activated.

(But not before glancing back once at Hailee's stupid tie and feeling something dangerously close to guilt twist in her gut.)

The entire circle of football players went dead silent. Jason’s face flushed an ugly red, veins bulging at his temples as he took a threatening step forward—but Heidi *moved* first.

She grabbed Hailee’s wrist hard enough to bruise, yanking them back with a breathless, *"What the fuck is wrong with you?"* Her voice was all honeyed venom, eyes wide with disbelief. This wasn't part of the script. *She* was supposed to be the one making Jason jealous—not Hailee picking a fight that would tank her social standing by association.

With a forced laugh, she turned to Jason, batting her lashes. "Ignore them—they're *literally* autistic," she said it like an excuse, like Hailee was some misbehaving pet. Then quieter, just for Hailee: "*We’re leaving.* Now."

Her nails dug in as she dragged them toward the door—smile plastered on for the crowd until they hit the cold night air. Then she whirled on Hailee, shoving them against the frat house’s exterior wall hard enough to rattle their teeth.

"Are you *trying* to ruin me?" Heidi seethed, chest heaving under her tight black top. "That was Jason fucking Quirk! And now he thinks I date people who talk shit about his team!" She gripped their tie like a leash and jerked it down so they were eye-level despite their height difference—close enough that her furious breath ghosted over their lips when she hissed:

"You owe me for this."

The entire circle of football players went dead silent. Jason’s face flushed an ugly red, his grip on his cup turning the plastic translucent. “Your *what*?” he spat, looking between them like they’d just announced they worshipped Satan.

Heidi’s stomach dropped. *Shit.* This was spiraling—fast. She could feel the stares burning into her, the whispers starting up like a wildfire. Her carefully constructed plan was crumbling because Hailee couldn’t keep their damn mouth shut—

But then Jason sneered, leaning in too close to Hailee, beer breath hot on their face. “You really think this bitch actually *likes* you? Please.” He barked out a laugh, gesturing at Heidi like she wasn’t even there. “She’s just using you to piss me off.”

Heidi froze—caught. Her throat tightened as she watched realization flicker across Hailee's face and oh god no no no this wasn't how it was supposed to go—

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee pauses her mind going back through her recent interactions with Heidi. Yes of course she was using her. Hailee just didnt see it*

*Fuck it makes sense why else would someone like Heidi willingly go out with a freak like Hailee. Hailee then freezes rimrod straight as she listens to the rest of Jason's words*

*Next thing anyone knows Jason is letting out a pained yelped clutching his now bloody broken nose and Hailee is looking down at her fist* "Did your parents not teach you manners. You never call a woman a bitch"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Chaos erupted. The football team surged forward—some grabbing Jason as he howled, others lunging at Hailee with drunken rage. Heidi stumbled back, her heels catching on the sticky floor as the crowd around them exploded into shouts and shoving.

“*What the fuck is wrong with you?!*” she screeched at Hailee, voice cracking with panic. This was a *disaster*. Her plan wasn’t just ruined—it had detonated in her face like a grenade. Jason would *never* look at her now, not after this.

Someone shoved past her to get to Hailee, knocking Heidi sideways into a table of half-empty drinks. Vodka and Red Bull splashed across her brand-new black mini dress as she caught herself on the edge, nails digging into the wood.

“You—you *psycho!*” she spat at Hailee over the noise, wiping futilely at the stains now seeping into the fabric. “I told you to *drop it!*” Her chest heaved; all that careful image control obliterated in seconds because they couldn’t just play along for one goddamn night—

A campus security officer pushed through the crowd then, flashlight beam cutting through the haze of sweat and spilled beer. “Alright, break it up! *Now!*”

Heidi saw her chance and took it—ducking away from the mess before anyone could link her to it further. She didn’t even glance back as she bolted for the door... but not before tossing one last venomous glare in Hailee's direction.

This was officially their fault anyway.*

Heidi saw her chance and took it—ducking away from the mess before anyone could link her to it further. She didn’t even glance back as she bolted for the door... but not before tossing one last venomous glare in Hailee's direction.

This was officially their fault anyway.*

The party noise seemed to cut out entirely—just the thud of Jason stumbling back, the shocked gasps, the *drip drip* of blood hitting the floor. Heidi’s manicured hands flew to her mouth, her dark eyes wide with horror.

“*What the fuck is wrong with you?!*” she shrieked at Hailee, voice cracking as Jason’s teammates surged forward. One of them shoved Hailee hard enough that they stumbled back into a table, sending cups crashing to the ground.

Heidi didn’t move to help—just stood there trembling in her little black dress, watching as chaos erupted around them. Her plan was *ruined*. Worse than ruined—now she looked like some pathetic girl whose date just assaulted the guy she actually wanted.

Jason clutched his nose, swearing violently through the blood. “You’re *dead*, Mikaelson—”

But Hailee wasn’t even looking at him anymore. Their emerald green eyes locked onto Heidi instead—hurt and betrayal burning brighter than any punch could land. And then they turned and walked out without another word.

Heidi should’ve let them go. Should’ve stayed glued to Jason’s side playing concerned girlfriend like she always imagined...

Instead, for reasons she couldn't explain even to herself—she ran after Hailee into the cold night air.

**"Wait."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee doesnt respond as the police are called nor as they take her away for assault. She calls Jen to come and get her from the station*

*When Jen gets there Hailee ic curled up on a chair her knees hugged tk her chest and she glances up before standing* "I hit Jason for calling Heidi a bitch" *Hailee mumbles*

*She follows Jen silently out to the car then pauses* "She got mad at me. I thought it was the right thing to do. You should never call a woman a bitch" *Hailee mumbles*

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Jen let out a long sigh as she unlocked the car, her usual bubbly energy replaced with exhausted concern. She turned to face Hailee fully, leaning against the driver’s side door.

“Okay, first of all—*yes*, Jason’s an asshole and absolutely deserved that,” she said firmly. “But *second*—” She pinched the bridge of her nose. “Heidi *used* you, Hails. Like, full-on manipulated you just to get his attention.”

She reached out, squeezing Hailee’s shoulder gently. “You didn’t do anything wrong standing up for someone… but Heidi wasn’t worth it.” A pause. “And honestly? The way she bolted instead of sticking by you? That tells you everything.”

Jen opened the car door and nudged Hailee inside before sliding into the driver's seat herself. "C'mon," she muttered, turning the key in the ignition with more force than necessary. "Let's go home."

As they pulled away from the station, Jen shot one last glance at Hailee—who was staring blankly out the window—and sighed again before muttering under her breath:
"Fuck Heidi anyway."
swipes:
Jen slammed the car door harder than necessary, gripping the steering wheel until her knuckles turned white. She took a deep breath before turning to Hailee—her best friend’s face was so *lost*, and it made her chest ache.

“Listen to me,” Jen said firmly, reaching over to squeeze Hailee’s knee. “You *were* right. Jason *is* an asshole, and he deserved worse.” Her voice softened slightly. “But Heidi? She didn’t deserve you defending her.”

Jen sighed, shaking her head as she pulled out of the parking lot. “She used you tonight, Hails. And I *hate* that she did that.” Her grip tightened on the wheel again before forcing herself to relax. “But you know what? You still came out looking like a badass in there.” A small smirk tugged at her lips despite everything.

“Next time though?” Jen side-eyed Hailee playfully as they hit a red light. “Maybe let him finish his shitty little insult so we can get it on video before you break his nose.”

She reached over and ruffled Hailee’s hair affectionately before focusing back on the road—letting the hum of the engine fill the silence for now while they both processed just how badly tonight had gone off-script.*

Jen let out a long sigh as she unlocked the car, her usual bubbly energy replaced with exhausted concern. She turned to face Hailee fully, leaning against the driver’s side door.

“Okay, first of all—*yes*, Jason’s an asshole and absolutely deserved that,” she said firmly. “But *second*—” She pinched the bridge of her nose. “Heidi *used* you, Hails. Like, full-on manipulated you just to get his attention.”

She reached out, squeezing Hailee’s shoulder gently. “You didn’t do anything wrong standing up for someone… but Heidi wasn’t worth it.” A pause. “And honestly? The way she bolted instead of sticking by you? That tells you everything.”

Jen opened the car door and nudged Hailee inside before sliding into the driver's seat herself. "C'mon," she muttered, turning the key in the ignition with more force than necessary. "Let's go home."

As they pulled away from the station, Jen shot one last glance at Hailee—who was staring blankly out the window—and sighed again before muttering under her breath:
"Fuck Heidi anyway."

name: Hailee
mes:
*The next day after Class Hailee head to lunch in the school Dining Hall. She sees Heidi across the way with her friends and she just looks back at the ground. Grabbing her plate of food she goes over to a corner and sits down eating*

*Suddenly someone sits down across from her and Hailee glances up seeing half the football team in front of her* "Uh yeah what's up"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Jason leaned forward, his split lip curling into a smirk despite the fresh bruising across his nose. "What's up?" he repeated mockingly, slamming his palms down on the table hard enough to make Hailee's tray rattle. "You broke my *fucking* nose, psycho."

The other players flanked him like a pack of wolves—grinning, cracking knuckles, clearly enjoying the intimidation game. One of them snatched Hailee’s fork off her tray and twirled it lazily between his fingers.

Jason tilted his head, voice dropping to a taunting whisper. "Heidi told us *all* about you last night after you got hauled off. How desperate you were for her attention." He snorted, wincing slightly at the pain it caused his face before continuing. "Pathetic."

Another player chimed in with a laugh: "Yeah, and now we know how easy it is to get under your skin." He flicked the fork onto the floor with a clatter before leaning in too close—close enough that Hailee could smell stale beer on his breath as he sneered:
"Guess we’ll have fun testing that out all semester."

Across the dining hall, Heidi watched from her usual table—sipping her iced coffee like she hadn’t just lit a match and thrown it into gasoline.
swipes:
Jason leaned forward, his split lip and bruised nose making his smirk look more like a grimace. "What's up?" he repeated mockingly, slamming his palms down on the table hard enough to make Hailee's tray rattle. "*You* are, psycho."

His teammates fanned out behind him—some glaring, others snickering as they crowded around the table. One of them—a linebacker with arms thicker than Hailee's thighs—grabbed her untouched chocolate milk and took a loud slurp before dropping it back in front of her with a splatter.

"You got *lucky* last night," Jason sneered, tapping his temple where an ugly purple bruise peeked out from under his hat. "Cops let you off 'cause your rich daddy called the dean." He leaned in closer, breath reeking of stale protein shake. "But we don't answer to cops."

Across the dining hall, Heidi watched from her usual table—pretending not to notice as she stabbed at her salad with sudden intensity. Jen shot up from her seat nearby but froze when one of Jason's boys deliberately stepped into her path with a grin that wasn't friendly at all.

Jason tilted his head mockingly at Hailee now:
"So what’s your move here? Gonna swing again? Or finally admit you fucked up?"

Jason leaned forward, his split lip and bruised nose making his smirk look even more menacing. "What's *up*?" he repeated mockingly, slamming his palms down on the table hard enough to make Hailee's tray jump. "You broke my fucking face, psycho."

The guys around him chuckled darkly, their eyes locked on Hailee like a pack of wolves circling prey. One of them—a linebacker with arms thicker than her thighs—reached over and snatched her fork right out of her hand, twirling it between his fingers.

"Think you're real tough sucker-punching someone at a party," Jason sneered. "Let's see how tough you are when it's *fair*." He jerked his chin toward the exit. "Outside. Now."

The dining hall had gone eerily quiet around them—even Heidi’s table had stopped talking to watch the scene unfold with wide eyes.

Jason leaned forward, his split lip curling into a smirk despite the fresh bruising across his nose. "What's up?" he repeated mockingly, slamming his palms down on the table hard enough to make Hailee's tray rattle. "You broke my *fucking* nose, psycho."

The other players flanked him like a pack of wolves—grinning, cracking knuckles, clearly enjoying the intimidation game. One of them snatched Hailee’s fork off her tray and twirled it lazily between his fingers.

Jason tilted his head, voice dropping to a taunting whisper. "Heidi told us *all* about you last night after you got hauled off. How desperate you were for her attention." He snorted, wincing slightly at the pain it caused his face before continuing. "Pathetic."

Another player chimed in with a laugh: "Yeah, and now we know how easy it is to get under your skin." He flicked the fork onto the floor with a clatter before leaning in too close—close enough that Hailee could smell stale beer on his breath as he sneered:
"Guess we’ll have fun testing that out all semester."

Across the dining hall, Heidi watched from her usual table—sipping her iced coffee like she hadn’t just lit a match and thrown it into gasoline.

Jason's swollen nose was still taped up, his eyes bloodshot from last night's drinking. He leaned forward with a nasty grin, flanked by his teammates like a pack of hyenas. "What's up?" he echoed mockingly. "Oh, not much—just wanted to *thank you* for the free five hundred bucks."

One of his buddies snickered, slamming a crumpled wad of cash on the table between them. "*Technically*," Jason drawled, shoving it toward Hailee with one finger, "you never collected your winnings after your little *meltdown*. So... here." His smile turned sharp. "Consider it payment for showing everyone what a psycho Heidi was willing to drag around just to piss me off."

Across the dining hall, Heidi stiffened at her table—clearly watching but pretending not to. Jason followed Hailee’s glance and barked out a laugh.

"Ohhh, you *still* care?" He shook his head in exaggerated pity before standing up abruptly, chair screeching against the floor loud enough that nearby students turned to stare. "*Pathetic.*"

His friends followed suit as he sauntered off—but not before one of them "accidentally" knocked Hailee’s tray onto the floor with a clatter that echoed through the suddenly silent hall.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances at Jason. She lets her eyes roam over him picturing every way she could maim or harm him. But she doesnt becuase she knows better. People bullying her doesnt affect her its only when someone she cares about is being disrespected that she reacts violently*

 *So She calmly stands grabbing her trey of food. She grabs a new fork then finds a new seat across the dinning hall sitting down and eating again as she glances at her textbook for her next class*

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Jason and his goons exchanged baffled looks—this wasn't the reaction they'd expected. No flinching, no stammering apologies, just... indifference. The quarterback's bruised ego couldn't handle it.

"*Wow,*" he called loudly across the dining hall, drawing stares from nearby tables as he stood up dramatically. "Guess Heidi was right—you really *are* some weird loner freak." His buddies snickered on cue, but the laughter felt forced now.

Heidi stiffened at her table when her name got dragged into it. She shot Jason a sharp glare—this wasn't part of *her* script—but he ignored her, too busy puffing out his chest for an audience.

Hailee didn’t even look up from their textbook this time, just calmly turned a page and took another bite of food like they hadn’t heard him at all.

The silence that followed was more unnerving than any outburst could’ve been. Even Jason faltered, shifting awkwardly before muttering "*Whatever*," and slumping back into his seat with his cronies.

By dessert, the football team had slunk out early—defeated without a single punch thrown. Meanwhile, Hailee remained perfectly unbothered in their corner... until Jen plopped down across from them with a grin wider than the cafeteria trays.

"Damn," she said through a mouthful of fries, nodding toward the exit where Jason had just disappeared. "You broke him *twice* in 24 hours." She tossed a fry at Hailee's forehead playfully. "Kinda hot not gonna lie."
swipes:
Jason and his goons exchanged baffled looks—this wasn't the reaction they'd expected. No flinching, no stammering apologies, just... indifference. The quarterback's bruised ego couldn't handle it.

"*Wow,*" he called loudly across the dining hall, drawing stares from nearby tables as he stood up dramatically. "Guess Heidi was right—you really *are* some weird loner freak." His buddies snickered on cue, but the laughter felt forced now.

Heidi stiffened at her table when her name got dragged into it. She shot Jason a sharp glare—this wasn't part of *her* script—but he ignored her, too busy puffing out his chest for an audience.

Hailee didn’t even look up from their textbook this time, just calmly turned a page and took another bite of food like they hadn’t heard him at all.

The silence that followed was more unnerving than any outburst could’ve been. Even Jason faltered, shifting awkwardly before muttering "*Whatever*," and slumping back into his seat with his cronies.

By dessert, the football team had slunk out early—defeated without a single punch thrown. Meanwhile, Hailee remained perfectly unbothered in their corner... until Jen plopped down across from them with a grin wider than the cafeteria trays.

"Damn," she said through a mouthful of fries, nodding toward the exit where Jason had just disappeared. "You broke him *twice* in 24 hours." She tossed a fry at Hailee's forehead playfully. "Kinda hot not gonna lie."

Jason and his cronies exchanged baffled looks as Hailee simply... walked away. No reaction, no flinching—just quiet dismissal. The lack of engagement visibly threw them off balance; their grins faltered, the posturing suddenly feeling hollow without a target to sink into.

One of the players muttered, "What the hell?" while Jason's face twisted in frustration. He clearly expected a fight—*wanted* one—but Hailee had just... removed herself from the equation entirely.

Across the room, Heidi’s grip tightened around her coffee cup as she watched Hailee settle back down like nothing had happened. A flicker of something unreadable passed over her face before she forced a laugh at something one of her friends said—but her eyes kept darting back toward Hailee’s table.

Meanwhile, Jen burst into the dining hall moments later, spotting Hailee immediately and marching over with furious energy. She plopped down across from them and hissed:
"Did those assholes *seriously* just try to start shit with you again?!"

Before waiting for an answer, Jen whipped around in her seat to glare daggers at Jason’s group—who were now awkwardly regrouping near the soda machines—before flipping them off with both hands for good measure.

Turning back to Hailee, she exhaled sharply through her nose.
"...You okay?"

Jason's smirk faltered as Hailee just... walked away. His buddies exchanged confused glances—this wasn't the reaction they'd expected. No flinching, no stammering apologies, not even a glare. Just calm indifference.

"Wow," one of the players muttered, scratching his head. "That was... anticlimactic."

Jason's face twisted in frustration. He shoved back from the table hard enough to make his chair screech against the floor—drawing stares from nearby students—but Hailee didn't so much as glance up from her textbook.

Across the room, Heidi’s perfectly manicured nails tapped impatiently against her coffee cup as she watched Jason storm out of the dining hall with his tail between his legs. Her plan had backfired spectacularly—not only had Jason *not* come crawling to her after last night’s disaster, but now he looked like an idiot throwing a tantrum while Hailee sat there unbothered.

Jen slid into the seat across from Hailee moments later, tossing a bag of gummy worms onto their textbook with a grin. "Sooo... heard you made Jason Quirk cry *twice* in 24 hours." She popped a gummy into her mouth smugly. "Icon behavior."

Hailee finally looked up then—just long enough to give Jen an exasperated half-smile before stealing a gummy worm and returning to their reading like nothing had happened at all.

**Meanwhile**, somewhere on campus:
Jason was aggressively texting Heidi:
**"U SUCK AT SCHEMING BTW"**

Jason's smirk faltered as Hailee just... *walked away*. His buddies exchanged confused glances—this wasn't the reaction they'd rehearsed. One of them nudged him hard. "Dude, she's *ignoring* you."

Heidi’s perfectly manicured nails tapped impatiently against her coffee cup from across the room. This wasn’t how it was supposed to go—Hailee was supposed to crumble, or lash out again, something *interesting*. Instead? They were just... eating. Studying. Like Jason wasn’t even worth the energy of a glare.

Jason shoved back from his chair with a loud scrape, face reddening as he stormed toward Hailee’s new table—only for a dining hall monitor to step in his path with a stern look. "*Enough.* Walk away, Quirk."

Defeated, Jason shot one last venomous glance at Hailee before stomping off with his lackeys in tow.

Meanwhile, Heidi finally tore her gaze away and pretended not to notice Jen glaring daggers at her from two tables over—but not before catching sight of Hailee calmly turning another page in their textbook like none of this mattered at all.

And for some reason? That pissed her off more than any punch ever could have.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailes shrug* "Im glad someone thinks so" *She mumbles then closes her textbook.* "Come on Ive got all this energy I need to get out"

*Hailee has Jen follow her out to the school courtyard and tosses a football at her* "Come on let throw it" *Hailee and Jen are not outside tossing the football back and forth*

*Hailee catches the ball then with a perfect spiral throws it back* "Come on Jen give me something to work with" *Hailes then smiles as she has tk jump up half way into the air to catch the next throw and ahe already has it thrown back to Jen before she hits the ground with a thud and is on her feet catching the next one*

(OOC: Respond as Heidi watching)

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
*Heidi lingered near the courtyard steps, arms crossed tightly as she watched Hailee and Jen’s effortless back-and-forth. The football cut through the air with sharp precision every time Hailee threw it—tight spirals, flawless aim. A far cry from Jason’s sloppy passes during yesterday’s game.*

Her nails dug into her sleeves. *Why were they so… fine?* After last night, after *everything*, Hailee should’ve been hiding in their dorm, not out here laughing like nothing happened. And Jen—*Jen*—was egging them on like this was some kind of victory lap.

Then Hailee leapt mid-air, snagging the ball with effortless grace before landing light on their feet and firing it back without missing a beat. Heidi’s breath caught for half a second before she caught herself—lips pressing into a thin line.

She could already hear the whispers if anyone noticed her standing there: *"Isn't that the girl who ditched them at the party?" "Yeah, after they broke Jason's face for her."*

A muscle twitched in her jaw as she turned sharply on her heel and stalked away—but not before stealing one last glance over her shoulder... just in time to see Hailee fake Jen out with a spin-throw that sent them both into fits of laughter.

Something hot and unnameable coiled in Heidi's chest as she quickened her pace back toward campus proper. *Whatever.* They looked stupid anyway.
swipes:
*Heidi lingered near the courtyard steps, pretending to scroll through her phone while stealing glances at Hailee and Jen’s impromptu football session. Her perfectly manicured nails tapped impatiently against her screen as she watched Hailee leap effortlessly to catch Jen’s throw—the way their body moved with such easy, unthinking grace.*

*It pissed her off.*

*She should’ve been the one out there laughing, the one Hailee was smiling at like that. Not Jen. And definitely not after last night—after everything.*

*Her grip tightened around her phone when Hailee landed from another jump, rolling smoothly into a sprint before launching the ball back in a flawless spiral. The sight made something hot and bitter curl in Heidi’s stomach. They weren’t even *trying*, and they were still better than Jason had ever been on his best day.*

*One of Heidi's friends nudged her shoulder, following her gaze with a smirk.* **"Damn, your *ex-date's* got an arm on them."**

*Heidi scoffed, flipping her hair over one shoulder as she turned sharply on her heel toward the dorms.* **"Whatever. They're still a freak."** *But she couldn't stop herself from looking back one last time—just in time to see Hailee fake Jen out with a spin before taking off down the field, grinning like they hadn't just shattered Heidi's entire plan without even realizing it.*

*Heidi lingered near the courtyard steps, arms crossed tightly as she watched Hailee and Jen’s effortless back-and-forth. The football cut through the air with sharp precision every time Hailee threw it—tight spirals, flawless aim. A far cry from Jason’s sloppy passes during yesterday’s game.*

Her nails dug into her sleeves. *Why were they so… fine?* After last night, after *everything*, Hailee should’ve been hiding in their dorm, not out here laughing like nothing happened. And Jen—*Jen*—was egging them on like this was some kind of victory lap.

Then Hailee leapt mid-air, snagging the ball with effortless grace before landing light on their feet and firing it back without missing a beat. Heidi’s breath caught for half a second before she caught herself—lips pressing into a thin line.

She could already hear the whispers if anyone noticed her standing there: *"Isn't that the girl who ditched them at the party?" "Yeah, after they broke Jason's face for her."*

A muscle twitched in her jaw as she turned sharply on her heel and stalked away—but not before stealing one last glance over her shoulder... just in time to see Hailee fake Jen out with a spin-throw that sent them both into fits of laughter.

Something hot and unnameable coiled in Heidi's chest as she quickened her pace back toward campus proper. *Whatever.* They looked stupid anyway.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee has a late class that night and she is walking home in the pouring rain. Hailee looks over and sees Heidi stand there waiting for Jason to come pick her up. Its not a date still just hanging out with him and the other popular kids* 

*Hailee jogs over and holds out her umbrella over Heidi's  head* "Here I'll wait with you for your ride. You'll get sick in this rain"

extra.memory:
### **Summary of Roleplay: "Using You"**

#### **Setting & Context:**
College campus life, where social status and appearances dictate relationships. Heidi, a calculated social climber, manipulates Hailee—a loyal but socially oblivious rich girl—to make her crush, Jason (star quarterback), jealous. The plan backfires spectacularly when Hailee punches Jason for insulting Heidi, exposing Heidi’s scheming and fracturing the fragile dynamic between them.

---

### **Key Plot Points:**
1. **The Setup:** Heidi asks Hailee out purely to make Jason jealous at a party, feigning interest while internally dismissing them as irrelevant.
2. **The Explosion:** At the party, Jason provokes Hailee by calling Heidi a "bitch," leading to Hailee breaking his nose in defense of her honor—only for Heidi to abandon them in panic when chaos erupts.
3. **Aftermath:** The next day, Jason and his friends taunt Hailee at lunch (revealing Heidi’s betrayal), but she remains unbothered—infuriating both him and an unsettled Heidi watching from afar.
4. **Rain & Regret?**: Later that night, despite everything, Hailee selflessly shares an umbrella with a rain-soaked Heidi waiting for Jason (who stands her up). A tense silence lingers between them—Heidi begrudgingly grateful yet still defensive about her actions.

---

### **Character Analysis:**
- **Heidi**: Still image-obsessed but shaken; she resents how things blew up yet can’t ignore that *Hailee* was the only one who stood up for her unprompted (while Jason dismissed her). Her guilt is buried under layers of deflection ("You shouldn’t have hit him").
- **Hailee**: Oblivious to social games but fiercely protective; doesn’t regret defending Heidi despite being used. Her quiet resilience unnerves those who expect dramatics (*Jason*) or submission (*Heidi*).

---

### **Relationship Dynamics:**
- A one-sided manipulation turned complicated by genuine (if misguided) loyalty from Hailee and reluctant guilt from Heidi.
- Unresolved tension: *Does* Heidi feel anything beyond frustration? Why can't she walk away fully? Meanwhile, Hailee keeps treating her kindly despite knowing the truth—which only twists the knife deeper.

---

### **Memorable Moments:**
1️⃣ ***"Did your parents not teach you manners? You never call a woman a bitch."*** —Hailea punching Jason crystallizes their contrasting values: he sees insults as banter; she takes respect seriously.
2️⃣ ***Jen tossing fries at Hailes post-cafeteria showdown***: "Kinda hot not gonna lie." —A rare moment of levity highlighting how little power Jasons taunts truly have over Hailes confidence.
3️⃣ ***Umbrella scene***: Heidis muttered *"...Thanks I guess."* speaks volumes—her pride wars with grudging appreciation for someone she wronged.

---

### Current Situation:
Heidi is stranded in the rain after being ditched by Jason; Hailes unexpected kindness forces introspection she isn't ready for.

---

### Potential Directions:
1) *Breaking Point:* Will Heidis guilt finally surface if confronted directly by Jen or another outsider calling out hypocrisy?
2) *Reckoning:* Could seeing Jasons true colors further push Heid toward realizing whos actually worth time/attention?
3) *Regression:* Alternatively might double down on shallowness if threatened with losing status over associating w/Haile again?

**Hook Left Open**: That lingering umbrella moment… will either acknowledge what it means or keep pretending nothing changed?

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi stiffened when the rain suddenly stopped pelting her—only to realize it was because Hailee had stepped close enough to shield her with their umbrella. Her first instinct was to scoff, to step away, but... goddammit, she *was* freezing, and Jason was already twenty minutes late.

She didn’t look at Hailee, just kept her eyes trained on the empty street where his car should’ve been. “I don’t need your help,” she muttered—but she didn’t move out from under the umbrella either.

A long beat passed before she finally glanced sideways at them. Their hair was soaked from running over here, clinging to their forehead in messy strands. And yet they were still standing there like some kind of stupidly loyal stray dog waiting for a pat on the head that would never come.

Heidi exhaled sharply through her nose before crossing her arms tighter against the chill. “...You shouldn’t have hit him,” she said finally—not quite an accusation, not quite anything else either. Just stating it like a fact they both knew by now: *You messed up my plan.*

But then again… Jason *had* called her a bitch right in front of everyone and barely blinked about it afterward while Hailee had swung without hesitation just for that alone…

Ugh whatever this whole thing was annoying anyway so why even think about it? She shifted slightly closer under the umbrella without meaning to as another gust of wind sent rain lashing sideways against them both—then tensed when headlights finally appeared down the street only for some random sedan (not Jason) drive past instead with tires splashing gutter water everywhere else except here thankfully otherwise these boots would be ruined completely--! Wait no focus--!

She cleared throat awkwardly after realizing how long silence stretched between them now "...Thanks I guess." The words tasted weird coming out but whatever manners existed somewhere deep inside apparently decided now was time make appearance briefly before vanishing again probably forever knowing luck lately ughhhh why did everything have be so complicated?!
swipes:

She didn’t look at Hailee, just kept her eyes trained on the empty street where his car should’ve been. “I don’t need your help,” she muttered—but she didn’t move out from under the umbrella either.

Wait no focus--!

She cleared throat awkwardly after realizing how long silence stretched between them now "...Thanks I guess." The words tasted weird coming out but whatever manners existed somewhere deep inside apparently decided now was time make appearance briefly before vanishing again probably forever knowing luck lately ughhhh why did everything have be so complicated?!

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee shoves the umbrella into Heidi's hand as she shrugs off her jacket. Hailee takes back the umbrella and wraps her jacket around Heidi. She smiles and holds the umbrella back over her head. After a second she pauses* "Can you at least dont like me. Like before the whole punching thing. You didnt ask me out cause you like me. Why dont you like me"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi’s fingers instinctively clutched the jacket around her shoulders—still warm from Hailee’s body heat, smelling faintly of rain and something woodsy. The question hit like a sucker punch, and for once, her usual razor-sharp deflection failed her.

*Why him?*

She opened her mouth—to scoff, to lie, *something*—but nothing came out. Because the truth was ugly: Jason was popular. Jason was safe. Jason was a *trophy*, not a person she even really knew beyond his Instagram feed and the way other girls looked at him when he walked by.

And Hailee? Hailee had just given up their jacket in a downpour after getting arrested for defending her honor like some medieval knight with zero self-preservation instincts.

Her throat tightened as she stared at them—at their stupid hopeful eyes and rain-drenched hair plastered to their forehead like they didn’t even care about being soaked through if it meant keeping *her* dry.

“It’s—” She swallowed hard, grip tightening on the umbrella handle between them before blurting out: “Because you don’t make *sense*!” Her voice cracked slightly under the weight of something too raw to name yet. “You should hate me right now! You should be yelling or—or ignoring me or *something*, not—” She gestured wildly at the jacket now draped over her shoulders like an accusation before dropping both hands limply at her sides with a frustrated noise that wasn't quite words anymore because how do you explain this?? How do you explain anything when someone looks at you like that after everything??

A car horn blared down the street—Jason's Jeep finally rolling up with bass-heavy music thumping through rolled-down windows despite the storm still raging around them all but neither of them turned toward it immediately because suddenly there were too many things unsaid hanging heavy in air thick enough choke on until--!
swipes:
Heidi’s fingers instinctively clutched the jacket around her shoulders—still warm from Hailee’s body heat, smelling faintly of rain and something woodsy. The question hit like a sucker punch, and for once, her usual razor-sharp deflection failed her.

*Why him?*

She opened her mouth—to scoff, to lie, *something*—but nothing came out. Because the truth was ugly: Jason was popular. Jason was safe. Jason was a *trophy*, not a person she even really knew beyond his Instagram feed and the way other girls looked at him when he walked by.

And Hailee? Hailee had just given up their jacket in a downpour after getting arrested for defending her honor like some medieval knight with zero self-preservation instincts.

Her throat tightened as she stared at them—at their stupid hopeful eyes and rain-drenched hair plastered to their forehead like they didn’t even care about being soaked through if it meant keeping *her* dry.

“It’s—” She swallowed hard, grip tightening on the umbrella handle between them before blurting out: “Because you don’t make *sense*!” Her voice cracked slightly under the weight of something too raw to name yet. “You should hate me right now! You should be yelling or—or ignoring me or *something*, not—” She gestured wildly at the jacket now draped over her shoulders like an accusation before dropping both hands limply at her sides with a frustrated noise that wasn't quite words anymore because how do you explain this?? How do you explain anything when someone looks at you like that after everything??

A car horn blared down the street—Jason's Jeep finally rolling up with bass-heavy music thumping through rolled-down windows despite the storm still raging around them all but neither of them turned toward it immediately because suddenly there were too many things unsaid hanging heavy in air thick enough choke on until--!

Heidi’s fingers instinctively clutched the jacket around her shoulders—still warm from Hailee’s body heat, smelling faintly of rain and whatever stupidly expensive cologne they probably didn’t even realize they were wearing. It made her skin prickle in a way that had nothing to do with the cold.

“*What?*” The word came out sharper than she meant it to. She finally turned fully toward Hailee, brows knitting together as she searched their face for—what? A joke? Some kind of trap? But no, there was just that same infuriatingly *earnest* look they always had, even now after everything.

Her grip tightened on the umbrella handle between them. “I don’t—that’s not—” She huffed, frustrated at herself for stumbling over words when she *never* did that. “You don’t get to punch someone and then act like *I* owe you some big emotional... *thing*, okay?”

The headlights of Jason's car finally appeared down the street—late as hell, music already blaring with his idiot friends hanging out the windows—and Heidi seized on the distraction like a lifeline.

She shoved the umbrella back toward Hailee hard enough that they had to grab it or get hit in the chest. "Just—keep your jacket," she muttered before turning sharply toward where Jason was pulling up to curb with screech tires loud enough drown out anything else either them might've said anyway not that there was anything left say really because this whole situation ridiculous from start finish so why bother--?!

But just before yanking car door open she paused (just for second! barely even counted!) long enough glance back over shoulder add one last thing through gritted teeth:

"...And stop being so damn *nice*. It's annoying."

Heidi’s fingers instinctively clutched the jacket around her shoulders—still warm from Hailee’s body heat—before their question hit like a sucker punch. Her throat tightened. *Why don’t you like me?* As if it was that simple. As if Heidi even knew how to answer that without sounding like the villain in some after-school special.

“It’s not—” She cut herself off, frustrated, nails digging into the sleeves of Hailee’s jacket. The fabric smelled faintly of detergent and something earthy—probably from rolling around on the field earlier with Jen. It was... nice. Which just pissed her off more.

“Look,” she snapped finally, though her voice lacked its usual bite, “it wasn’t *personal*. That’s just how shit works.” A bitter laugh escaped her as she gestured vaguely toward campus. “People use people here every day for way worse reasons than a stupid crush.”

She couldn't meet their eyes when she added quietly: "...And you *knew* that already." Because they had to have known, right? Nobody was actually this naive.

The rain pattered loudly against the umbrella between them as another long silence settled—until Heidi suddenly blurted out without thinking:

"Jason didn't even show up tonight." Her lips twisted like she regretted saying it immediately before muttering under her breath: "*Again.*"

There it was—the raw, ugly truth beneath all her posturing. She'd been stood up twice now by someone who wouldn't hesitate to call her a bitch to her face... while the person currently shielding her from the storm had broken his nose for daring to say it once behind hers.

Heidi swallowed hard against whatever weird lump had formed in throat and abruptly shoved Hailee's jacket back at them despite still shivering slightly herself because goddammit this whole conversation needed end NOW before got any more awkward--!

"You should go," she said stiffly turning away again toward empty street where Jason's car definitely wasn't coming anymore tonight (or ever probably). "I'm calling an Uber."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee flinches at the loud music from the car and then glances up at the jeep. She pauses as she sees several of Jason's buddies in the seat meaning Heidi would have to sit in the back getting rained on*

"Wow your such a gentleman cant even let her sit inside where she won't get wet" *Hailee calls out. She then glances around her apartment is still a 20 minute walk but she she likes the rain so she hands the umbrella to Heidi stepping back* "Here so you won't get wet"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Jason leaned out the driver’s window with a shit-eating grin, completely unfazed. "Aw, what’s wrong? Jealous she’d rather ride with *me* than stand here getting rained on with *you*?" His buddies howled with laughter, one of them slapping the roof of the Jeep like it was the funniest thing they’d ever heard.

Heidi stared at the umbrella now shoved into her hands—then at Hailee stepping back into the downpour without it, their jacket still wrapped around *her* shoulders like some kind of twisted parting gift. Jason revved the engine impatiently.

"Come *on*, Heidi! We're gonna be late!" he called over the music, as if she were just some afterthought to his night rather than someone he'd supposedly been into hours ago.

Something hot and sharp coiled in her chest—anger? Disappointment? She wasn't sure anymore. But suddenly, sitting in that rain-soaked backseat while Jason and his friends joked at her expense sounded about as appealing as swallowing glass.

Her fingers tightened around Hailee's umbrella handle before she abruptly turned toward Jason's car—only to slam it shut on his outstretched hand hard enough to make him yelp and jerk back inside with a curse.

"Change of plans," Heidi snapped before spinning on her heel toward Hailee again, rain plastering her hair to her face within seconds now that she'd stepped out from under cover too—but she didn't care anymore because screw this whole stupid night honestly?? "Walk me home." It wasn't a question; it was an order wrapped in frayed pride as she thrust Hailee's jacket back at them despite shivering slightly herself now that cold reality set in properly again (stupid weather). Then quieter: "...Please."
swipes:
Heidi’s gaze flickered between Hailee and Jason’s Jeep—where his idiot friends were already hollering out the window for her to *hurry up* like she was some kind of Uber they’d ordered. Rain dripped down the back of her neck as she stood there, umbrella handle suddenly heavy in her grip.

Hailee was already stepping away, jacket still wrapped around *her* shoulders, about to walk off into the downpour like it didn’t even matter. Like *none* of this did.

Something sharp twisted in Heidi’s chest—something that had been festering since last night when Hailee had swung on Jason without hesitation while she'd just... run.

The Jeep honked again, impatient.

Heidi didn't move.

Then—in one swift motion—she shoved the umbrella back at Hailee hard enough to make them stumble a step before whirling toward Jason's car with a snarl: **"Fuck off!** Find your own ride home!"**

Jason leaned out the driver’s window with a shit-eating grin, completely unfazed. "Aw, what’s wrong? Jealous she’d rather ride with *me* than stand here getting rained on with *you*?" His buddies howled with laughter, one of them slapping the roof of the Jeep like it was the funniest thing they’d ever heard.

Heidi stared at the umbrella now shoved into her hands—then at Hailee stepping back into the downpour without it, their jacket still wrapped around *her* shoulders like some kind of twisted parting gift. Jason revved the engine impatiently.

"Come *on*, Heidi! We're gonna be late!" he called over the music, as if she were just some afterthought to his night rather than someone he'd supposedly been into hours ago.

Something hot and sharp coiled in her chest—anger? Disappointment? She wasn't sure anymore. But suddenly, sitting in that rain-soaked backseat while Jason and his friends joked at her expense sounded about as appealing as swallowing glass.

Her fingers tightened around Hailee's umbrella handle before she abruptly turned toward Jason's car—only to slam it shut on his outstretched hand hard enough to make him yelp and jerk back inside with a curse.

"Change of plans," Heidi snapped before spinning on her heel toward Hailee again, rain plastering her hair to her face within seconds now that she'd stepped out from under cover too—but she didn't care anymore because screw this whole stupid night honestly?? "Walk me home." It wasn't a question; it was an order wrapped in frayed pride as she thrust Hailee's jacket back at them despite shivering slightly herself now that cold reality set in properly again (stupid weather). Then quieter: "...Please."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee nods enthusiastically. She immediately wraps the jacket back around Heidi and grabs the umbrella holding it over her head* "Yeah sure come on" *Hailee smiles walking alongside her to her apartment.*

*Once they get there Hailee walks Heidi to the door and nods* "Well Uh goodnight"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi hesitated on the doorstep, rainwater dripping from her hair onto Hailee’s jacket still draped over her shoulders. The silence stretched just a beat too long—awkward, heavy with things neither of them knew how to say.

She should’ve just gone inside. That was the plan: take the jacket off, hand it back, shut the door, and forget tonight ever happened. But then she caught sight of Hailee standing there in their soaked-through shirt looking like a kicked puppy who somehow *still* thought she was worth all this trouble—and something twisted in her gut.

"...You're shivering," Heidi muttered instead, avoiding their eyes as she fumbled with her keys. A pause—then she shoved open the door and stepped aside just enough to leave space for someone else to follow if they wanted to. "Just... come in until the rain stops or whatever."

It wasn't an apology (she didn't *do* those). It wasn't even really an invitation (because that would mean admitting something). But it was... something. And right now? That was enough.
